Articles.Content:
Ever wonder what software/hardware other people play their games on?

Well, the purpose of this thread is simple: Post your main gaming computer's specs!

No pictures needed, just specs please - please follow this format (leave blank where applicable) -

Computer Name -

Operating System -

CPU -

Motherboard -

RAM -

GPU(s) -

Optical Drive(s) -

HDD(s) -

SSD(s) -

Chassis -

PSU -

CPU Cooler -

Additional Internal Components -

Edited March 20, 2015 by segaprophet

Computer Name -

Operating System - Windows 7

CPU - i7-3770 @ 3.4ghz

Motherboard - Foxconn H77MXV

RAM - 8gb DDR3 1333

GPU(s) - EVGA GeForce GTX 660 2gb

Optical Drive(s) -

HDD(s) - 1tb

SSD(s) - 32gb(thats just my boot drive)

Chassis -

PSU - Cooler Master 550W Elite V2 ATX 12V

CPU Cooler - Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO

Additional Internal Components -

Operating System - Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 x64

CPU - Intel Core i5 3570K

Motherboard - Intel DZ77BH55K LGA 1155 Z77 ATX

RAM - Samsung 8GB (2x4GB) 240-Pin DDR3 DDR3 1600 (PC3 12800) (MV-3V4G3D/US)

GPU(s) - MSI Radeon HD 7950 3GB/OC

Optical Drive(s) - Sony Optiarc 24X DVD Burner

HDD(s) - Western Digital Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM

SSD(s) - n/a

Chassis - Corsair Carbide 300R ATX mid-tower (non-windowed)

PSU - SeaSonic X750 80Plus Gold 750W ATX Full Modular

CPU Cooler - Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO

Additional Internal Components - Linksys 802.11n wireless network PCI card

Motherboard - ASRock Z97M-ITX/AC

HDD(s) - people still use these?

PSU - 450w

CPU Cooler - stock

Additional Internal Components - none
Does this thread have a point? Or is it just list after list?

Does this thread have a point? Or is it just list after list?

Lists as numerous as the day is long, my man! Lists, lists everywhere!
thats pretty much the point of the thread. people listing their computer specs for others not to read.

Squad can read it to optimize for specific hardware...

Operating System: Windows 7 64bit

CPU: i5 3570k @ 4,2Ghz

Motherboard: Asrock Z77 Pro 3

RAM: 2*8 GB DDR3-2133

GPU: ASUS HD 7970 DCII

Optical Drive: A cheap DVD drive

HDD: 1,5TB, almost never plugged in since its so noisy

SSD: Samsung 830 256GB

Chassis: Anidees AI6

PSU BeQuiet Straight Power E9 480W

CPU: Cooler BeQuiet Dark Rock Pro 2

Additional Internal Components: Asus Xonar DG, several silent fans

thats pretty much the point of the thread. people listing their computer specs for others not to read.

Nailed it.

Computer Name - None usually... the network name is UberlÃƒÂ¶ken though.

Operating System - Windows 8.1

CPU - AMD Athlon 750k, 4.4Ghz

Motherboard - ASUS F2A85-M Pro

RAM - 2x4 Patriot Viper 3 DDR3 1600

GPU(s) - MSI Radeon R9 270 2GB, overclocked to 270x levels

Optical Drive(s) - Yes

HDD(s) - 0 (well, one in a dock for backups)

SSD(s) - 1 x 480 GB

Chassis - Antec GX500

PSU - Corsair CX600M

CPU Cooler - Thermaltake T30

Additional Internal Components - Card Reader

Kicking myself that I didn't get a Athlon 860k, as it is actually newer and slightly better (I though it was a stock-overclocked 750k at the time). I also could have gotten an Anniversery Pentium if I waited a bit (wasn't aware of it) but I'm not sure I would have gotten it anyway. Also got the 480 GB SSD for really cheap due to specific circumstances.

Edited March 20, 2015 by Weegee

thats pretty much the point of the thread. people listing their computer specs for others not to read.

That was exactly what I thought. I will move along then.

I use my laptop that I bought with about 9500 AirMiles

Computer Name - HP Envy dv6

Operating System - Win 8.1 (I don't understand why everyone hates on it so much)

CPU - i7-3630QM @ 2.4 GHz

Motherboard -

RAM - 8 GB

GPU(s) - Intel HD Graphics 4000 / nVidia GT630m (2GB)

Optical Drive(s) - HP DVD-RAM

HDD(s) - 667GB (forget the "rated" size)

SSD(s) -

Chassis -

PSU -

Additional Internal Components - Wireless-N, bluetooth, Beats audio, fingerprint scanner, touchpad, webcam

Operating System - Windows 7 Home Premium

CPU - Intel i7 4790K @ 4.5 GHz

Motherboard - MSI Z97 PC Mate

RAM - 2 x 8 Corsair Vengeance LP

GPU(s) - ASUS Strix GTX 970 @ 1.4 GHz AND EVGA GTX 550 TI (I have two graphics cards running simply because I lack the proper cables to run my two monitors off of one GPU.)

Optical Drive(s) - One

HDD(s) - 5 - Totals to 1.22 TB

SSD(s) - 1 - Totals to 83.8 GB

PSU - EVGA SuperNova NEX 750G

CPU Cooler - Noctua D15

Additional Internal Components - NZXT Sentry Mix 2, 5.25 Drive Bay Storage Box, Thermaltake Hot-Swap Bay

Computer Name - "Victoria" or "Athena", depending on my mood.

Operating System - Windows 7

CPU - AMD A8 4500M

Motherboard - Ethel. Or was it Gertrude? I've always been bad with names.

RAM - 6 GB.

GPU(s) - Apparently the CPU's also the GPU. Whodathunkit.

Optical Drive(s) - Makes my old games on disc spin like a 45.

HDD(s) - Hard dusty drive? Just go out in the country, but you better have good shocks.

SSD(s) - 256 GB Crucial.

Chassis - Out of a '67 Pontiac.

PSU - I don't go to Penn State University.

CPU Cooler - Fans+Air

Additional Internal Components - Dust. Air. Metal. Plastic. Wires. Rubber. CIA wiretaps. Cold war-era radar equipment.
